Talon:

Talon helped Kenzo to move Tucson


From: Kraftlos 
Sent: Thursday,=
 January 21, 2010 3:18 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: The Old =
Maximal Base/Unicron's come back


  
Lord Perseus arrived in the corridor =
holding a bright lantern.

"Where are you hurt?" asked Kenzo.  "I'm a docto=
r."

He didn't even wait to hear the answer, he could see the damage.  Lord=
 Perseus looks over at the door to the control room and keys his radio.

"O=
pen the control room door, Tuscon is injured and we're bringing him in" he =
said.

"Rodger opening the door."

A second later the door opens and Ravenc=
hief is standing there in the entrance to the room.

"What is the status of=
 the CR chambers?"

"I'm glad to see you boss," Ravenchief replied.  "We ne=
ed to get the power back on.  This one pod is in stasis mode, but the other=
s wont activate without power."

Kenzo motions to Talon to help him move Tu=
scon into the room, he takes one shoulder.



On Thu, Jan 21, 2010 at 10:37=
 AM, Sandy <magicquartz@...> wrote:

  Tucson opens his clear blue ey=
es, even though he couldn't see anything through them. Through all his toug=
hness he was actually a very nice guy with a lot of good spark in him.  He =
puts a hand on Talon's to let her know that yes, he's taking her advice and=
 is very appreciative of her concern.

  " I suppose I - should have warned=
 you what - I was like on the battle field.  Sometimes - thinking outside t=
he box works and - sometimes it doesn't.  In - this case, I - think it went=
 both - ways. "

  He shifts his weight while sitting down.  Discomfort in =
his joints was now setting in.

  " When - I started training as an Autobot=
, I did follow - the rules but sometimes I - would stray off from the norma=
l routine.  Kup - called that wrecklessness with finesse. He - would jump d=
own - my aft for it all  - the time.  I - simply - told him - old - habits =
- die hard."

  He chuckles lightly when he remembers his rookie days.

  "=
 Kup - would - lecture me - but - he said it wasn't anything - against my f=
ighting style.  It - was because I - was lucky enough - to be built with - =
surprisingly - good - looks and he didn't want me to get too banged up or e=
lse - those damages could tarnish them."

  Tucson wasn't much for vanity a=
s he chuckles the story off.

  " I'd laugh it off of course.  To me - maki=
ng - a difference for - the citizens of - Cybertron is far more satisfying =
than - keeping up vanity.  Not - to mention a good run through rugged outdo=
or terrain. That - also drove Kup crazy.  When I get mud on - my windshield=
 I get a big kick out of it."

  He takes a few minutes to catch his breath=
 and gently squeezes Talon's hand to let her know he was still with her.
